WMD

Enhancements

Skeleton Arm 150 kr

Named for its skeletal appearance, this crude prosthetic arm lacks sense feedback. While providing the basic manipulation, the user must be able to see. +1 Difficulty to tests where objects are not visible.

Skeleton Leg 150 kr

Named for its skeletal appearance, this crude prosthetic leg lacks sense feedback. While providing the basic function of walking, it has a noticeable abnormal gait. +1 Difficulty to Blend In tests.

Mechano-Arm 1000 kr

A sturdy mechanical arm with sense feedback. Room for one enhancement.

Mechano-Leg 1000 kr

A sturdy mechanical leg with sense feedback. Room for one enhancement.

Intravenous Port 100 kr

Allows non-alchemists to inject alchemical Infusions or less reputable substances. Often seen on the necks and arms of soldiers and addicts.

Auto-Scribe 200 kr

Pressing the carefully machined glass lens against writing lets the auto-scribe copy the document. At a rate of 6 pages per minute, the encoded instructions to replicate the writing is typewritten into the attached metal drum. Roughly the size of a brick.

Dolman's Liver 500 kr

Created by targeted application of polarized æther, a Dolman's Liver permanently increases the body's ability to process toxins. Add +1 die to Grit Teeth tests involving poison or toxin.

Finger Gun 250 kr

This artificial finger conceals a single-shot derringer. Can be used by fleshy or prosthetic hands.

Grenades

Smoke Grenade 50 kr

Oily smoke obscures the affected area for 1 minute (20 rounds). +1 Difficulty to actions or targeting enemies obscured by smoke.

Peppergas Grenade 50 kr

Puffs of aerosolized irritants cloud the air. All characters in the affected area must pass a Grit Teeth (1) test or have the Damaged Eyes status for 1 minute (20 rounds). Characters with damaged eyes have +1 Difficulty to tests which require vision.

Improvised Explosive 50 kr

An explosive device cobbled together with improvised materials. If the explosive detonates, it deals 5d6 damage to all affected characters. Roll a d6: On a 1 something prevents the explosive from detonating.

Explosive Grenade 100 kr

A grenade designed to eject deadly shrapnel. When the grenade detonates it deals 6d6 damage to all affected characters. Armoured characters which take damage from the explosion gain 2 Shatter points instead of 1.

Breaching Charge 200 kr

A device designed to destroy buildings with a focused explosion. Once activated, the charge detonates after a 6-second (2 round) delay, dealing 8d6 damage in a 1x1 square area. The damage dealt by the charge is doubled against objects.

Alchemist’s Fire 100 kr

Burning propellants coats the affected area for 1 minute (20 rounds). Characters which start their turn or pass through the affected area are lit on fire. Burning characters are dealt 2 damage directly to their HP at the end of their turn. Burning characters can spend an Action to extinguish themselves.

Phosphorous Flasher 100 kr

The flasher detonates in bright flash and loud boom. All characters in the affected area must pass a Grit Teeth (2) test or have damaged eyes and ears for 1 minute (20 rounds). Characters with damaged eyes have +1 Difficulty to tests which require vision. Characters with damaged ears have +1 Difficulty to tests which require hearing.

Sleeping Gas Grenade 500 kr

Artificial chemicals mix to create a strong soporific gas. All characters in the affected area must pass a Grit Teeth (1) test or fall asleep for 1 minute (20 rounds). Sleeping characters fall Prone and are unconscious for the duration unless they take damage or another character takes an Action to shake them awake.

Mustard Gas Grenade 500 kr

Noxious emissions burn and choke all unfortunate enough to be exposed to the ghostly yellow gas. All characters in the affected area must pass a Grit Teeth (2) test or be dealt 3d6 damage directly to their HP.

Ætheric Disruptor 500 kr

Controlled æther annihilation disrupts nearby æther channels. All characters in the affected area must pass an Ætheric Engineering (2) test or the Director chooses 2 enchantments or magical items to disable for 1 minute (20 rounds).

Roles

Mastermind

  • Role ability: Planning

Your ability to prepare in advance, create contingency plans, or improvise in the moment.

A Mastermind has a dice pool maximum equal to your Planning rank. Before you make a skill test, you may choose to substitue your Planning pool instead of the called skill.

When you choose to substitute your Planning pool, you use all the dice in the pool. Each time you fail a skill roll, add one die to your Planning pool. When you have a day of non-strenuous downtime activity, you may add one die to your Planning pool.

Alchemist

  • Role ability: Synthesis

Requires 4 hours and 200kr worth of reagents to synthesize a batch of Infusions. The number of usable doses is equal to the number of Synthesis successes. It requires an Action to administer an infusion.

Infusions

Elixir of Life

Recover 3d6 damage.

Jet

+2 movement for 1m. Jittery for the next 24h.

Purgative

Target is cleansed of all effects of poison or alchemical Infusions. 1 round of vomiting; 1m of profuse sweating; clammy and cold for the next 24h

Clotting Agent

Stabilizes a dying character. Nauseous and pale for the next 24h.

Poison

Inflict 2d6 damage directly to HP when injected or consumed. Unpleasant tingling for 1m.

Archanist

  • Role ability: Ætherlink

Make a connection with a target in line-of-sight within 50 meters. An Arcanist can sense the distance (but not direction) of a connected target. Maintaining a connection does not require line of sight. Connections break when the distance between a target and the Arcanist exceeds 50 meters. An Arcanist can use an Action to manifest up to 3 Invocations (Only 1 Invocation per connection per turn).

Invocations

Slowdown

Reduce speed of target for 1m. Minimum speed of 1.

  • [1S] -1 speed
  • [2S] -1d6 speed

Pain Induction

Inflict damage diretly to a target's HP. Does not inflict Shatter.

  • [2S] 2d6 damage
  • [3S] 3d6 damage

Paralysis

Cause your target's muscles to seize.

  • [3S] Cannot move for 1m.
  • [4S] Cannot move or take Actions for 1m.
  • [5S] Lose consciousness and fall prone for 1m. Using an action will wake the target.

Knock

Cause the target to hear a noise.

  • [1S] A brief noise.
  • [3S] A short verbal phrase.

Manipulate

Try to remotely effect an ætheric device.

  • [Variable] Depends on complexity of effect.

Underboss

  • Role ability: Goons

A Goon is a non-player ally. An Underboss starts with and may have up to 2 Goons.

It takes 7 days of effort to recruit a new Goon. When you recruit a Goon, choose their name, a brief description, one of the Goon Archetypes, and Goon Capabilities equal to your Underboss rank.

Goon Loyalty

A goon starts with 6 Loyalty and 0 Distrust.

The following things will cause a Goon to gain a point of loyalty:

  • Free weekends or holidays. The weekend is the 7th, 14th, 21st, and 28th day of each month.
  • Large bonuses of Kronor or other valuable items

The following things will cause a Goon to lose a point of loyalty:

  • Accompanying you on a mission
  • Being shot at or placed in mortal danger
  • Conducting extensive research or stakeouts to uncover hidden information
  • Rushing downtime jobs

When loyalty reaches 0, the Goon marks a point of Distrust and has loyalty reset to 6. The Director will secretly roll a d6. If the number rolled is equal to or lesser than the Goon's Distrust rating, the goon is now disloyal.

A disloyal goon will prioritize their own interests over their Underboss. They might quit immediately, start embezzling money - or in more extreme situations - betray their former boss to their enemies.

Goon Archetypes

A Goon has the benefit of one of the following archetypes:

  • Bodyguard: 50% chance to not lose loyalty when put in a life-threatening situation or fired upon.
  • Informant: 50% chance to not lose loyalty when tasked with information gathering jobs.
  • Specialist: 50% chance to not lose loyalty when asked to rush downtime work.

Goon Capabilities

A Goon has a number of capabilities equal to the Underboss's rank:

  • Motor Pool: (1wk repairs)
  • Lookout:
  • Small Arms Training:
  • Heavy Weapons Guy:
  • Arcane Engineer:
  • Clothier / Tailor:
  • Amateur Chemist:
  • Private Eye: (Research + Stakeout)
  • Costume Stealth Guy:
